titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid to the Smith College Archives long playing (LP) records collection CA.MS.01116
titlestmt.author: Madeline Michels

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-07-26 15:33:18 -0400.

did.unittitle: Smith College Archives long playing (LP) records collection
did.abstract: The LP collection was created by the Smith College Archives from various sources. The LP collection consists mainly of recorded speeches and musical performances by Smith College individuals and groups. They span the twentieth century.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Until we move into New Neilson in early 2021, collections are stored in multiple locations and may take up to 48 hours to retrieve. Researchers are strongly encouraged to contact Special Collections (specialcollections@smith.edu) at least a week in advance of any planned visits so that boxes may be retrieved for them in a timely manner.
The records are open to research according to the regulations of the College Archives.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The LP Records were donated over a period of time from a variety of sources.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection of LPs are divided according to size â€“ 10", 12" and 16/17".

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The collection is open to research. However, Smith College Special Collection may not have the equipment to play these LPs. Contact special collections staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Smith College Archives long playing (LP) records collection, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-01116, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The LP collection consists mainly of recorded speeches and musical performances by Smith College individuals and groups. They span the twentieth century. Significant speeches to the college body were often recorded. These could be ceremonial (the inauguration of President Wright; the presentation of an honorary degree to Eleanor Roosevelt) or religious (chapel readings by President Neilson; chapel remarks by Annetta Clark). The voices of college Presidents Seelye, Neilson and Wright can all be found in the LPs. Smith traditions such as Rally Day and Christmas Vespers are also preserved in this collection. More well-known recordings are records by the Smiffenpoofs, Smithereens, and Octavians, three of Smith's a cappella choirs. The Smith College Glee Club, Choir, Chamber Singers, and Chamber Orchestra also made recordings of their concerts that now reside in the archives. Miscellaneous LPs include several International Quizzes that Smith students participated in, and the Smith College 75th Anniversary Fund radio spots.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

did.unittitle: Edna Williams of Spoken American English [8"]
Smith College Senior Song/Candidate for New Alma Mater
1-2 - Chapel Readings by President William Allan Neilson of Smith College, the 90th Psalm and Proverbs 31
3-5 - Digging Up Bible Life, Dr. Elihu Grant, Robinson Recording Labs, Discs #2-4
6 - "We're '39" -- Newt Perry's Orchestra, Smiffenpoofs -- music by Jeanne Perkins, words by Rose Kummel
14-16 - H.M. Cam -- Parts 1-5 and degree to Mrs. F.D.R.
27 - Smiffenpoof Album -- "St. Louis Blues", Mood Indigo", "One, Two, Three, Four"
28 - Smiffenpoof Album -- "The Night is Young", "Put a Penny in the Drum", "My Cutie's Due", "Oh What A Man"
29 - Smiffenpoof Album -- "My Heart Took a Walk", "Lindy", "Theme", "S'posin'"
30 - Vie Universitaire -- Interview d'etudiantes de "Smith College" par Daniel Perrin
33-33a - "The Smith Medley" -- Smithereens; "Handle Me With Care", "Tumblin' Tumbleweed" -- Octavians
34-34a - "Lydia the Tattooed Lady" -- Octavians; "I'm Bidin' My Time, "Happy Cuz I Have You" -- Smithereens
35-35a - "Round Boogie", "Salvation Army Song", "Oh What A Man", "My Cutie's Due" -- Smiffenpoofs
38-39 - "Love Among the Ruins" -- Smith Faculty Show
40 - Louise Rood, Viola and Robert Miller, Piano -- Sonatina (Edwin London) and Sonatina in G Minor, Op. 137, No. 3 (Schubert)
41 - Louise Rood, Viola and Robert Miller, Piano -- Sonata in F (Bach) & Louise Rood, Viola -- Sonata for Viola Alone, Op. 25, No. 1
43-44 - Smith College Glee Club -- directed by Iva Dee Hait and accompanied by Helen Bilhorn
43-45 - "Mass in B Minor" (Bach) -- Parts 1-6 -- Smith College Glee Club, Amherst College Glee Club, and Five College Chamber Orchestra
48 - "Christmas Vespers, 1974" -- Smith College -- Glee Club, Harvard Glee Club, Smith College Choirs
49 - "Christmas Vespers, 1975" -- Smith College -- Glee Club, Amherst College Glee Club, Smith College Choirs
50 - "Christmas Vespers, 1976" -- Smith College -- Glee Club, Harvard Glee Club, Smith College Choirs, and The Chamber Orchestra
51 - "College Choirs at Christmas" -- Amherst College Glee Club
52 - "College Choirs at Christmas" -- The Morgan State University
53 - "College Choirs at Christmas" -- Smith College Glee Club
55 - "Christmas Vespers, 1978" -- Harvard Glee Club and Smith College Choirs
57 - "Christmas Vespers, 1979" -- Smith College Glee Club and Union College Glee Club
59 - "Christmas Vespers, 1980" -- Glee Club and Choir, Union College Men's Glee Club, Smith College Alpha and Omega Choirs
61 - "Christmas Vespers, 1980" -- Smith College Glee Club and Choir, Union College Men's Glee Club, Smith College Alpha and Omega Choirs
65 - Music from the Rally Days of 1951 at Smith College
67-68 - "The Smith College Chamber Singers on Tour"
69 - Smith College Glee Club, conducted by Robert Brawley; Smith College Octavians, directed by Alice Parker
70-72 - Smith College Glee Club, conducted by Robert Brawley -- Parts 3-8
73 - "Gardening for Blind Persons" -- The Cleveland Society for the Blind
77-80 - Opening Dedication of Josten Werner Performing Arts Library
81 - Smith College Glee Club and Princeton University Glee Club
82 - The Smith-Princeton Chamber Chorus in Europe
86 - Smith College Glee Club with the Harvard Glee Club - 75th Anniversary Concert
